Unable to retrieve all game data for the selected software.

messages.005:
The WAD you have selected (title ID: {0}) is invalid.
This could be for any of the following reasons:
  • The currently-selected console does not match that used by the WAD.
  • The WAD is not yet available in the database.
  • The WAD has already been modified (i.e. injected or converted to a forwarder).
messages.006:
You can replace the original Virtual Console game's Operations Guide manual.

To do this, you need a ZIP containing the extracted/modified contents of a manual .arc from a VC WAD.
messages.007: Not a valid emanual contents item.

messages.009: You are currently already up to date.

messages.e_013: The BIOS file was not found or is unsupported. This option will be disabled in the emulator settings.

tooltips.000: Name displayed on the Wii Menu, when hovering over the channnel icon.
tooltips.001:
Channel's title ID.
If another one already exists with the same ID, installing this one will overwrite it!
tooltips.002:
Channel's target supported region.
It is generally recommended to set it to the region of your Wii console, instead of 'region free'. Setting the wrong region setting will trigger a 'This channel cannot be used' error if the channel is opened on a region-locked Wii.
tooltips.003: Full name displayed in the Data Management settings on the Wii Menu.
tooltips.004: Specifies whether to automatically fill in the savedata title using the channel's name and the second line of the banner's full title (if it is multiline).
tooltips.005:
Changes the Wii video display mode used by the channel.
Some video modes may not work depending on the software, so it is recommended to use only one target video mode for your Wii system (e.g. only PAL60) instead of a combination (e.g. NTSC + PAL60).
tooltips.006: The full title of the game, as displayed on the channel banner preview.
tooltips.007: The year when the software was released, if it is known.
tooltips.008: The (maximum) number of players supported by the software, if it is known. Some systems may not support multiplayer mode.
tooltips.009: Specifies whether the WAD should use the official emulator or serve as a forwarder to a homebrew single-ROM loader (SRL).
tooltips.010:
Use an offline WAD file from disk instead of downloading one by default.
This is recommended if you want to avoid potential copyright/piracy issues.

settingsform.auto_update_check: Check for updates automatically on startup
settingsform.auto_retrieve_gamedata_online: Automatically retrieve after opening a ROM
settingsform.autolink_save_data: Link save data title automatically with banner and channel names

vc_sega.dev_mdpad_enable_6b: Enable Six Button Control Pad for {0}

adobe_flash.midi: Enable MIDI playback using DLS soundfont
